Context: An editor will edit seven articles, one at a time. Three of the articles—G, H, and J—cover finance; three other articles—Q, R, and S—cover nutrition; and the remaining article, Y, covers wildlife. The order in which the articles are edited is subject to the following conditions: Consecutive articles cannot cover the same topic as each other. S can be earlier than Q only if Q is third. S must be earlier than Y. J must be earlier than G, and G must be earlier than R.
Question: In the order in which the articles are edited, S could be in any of the following positions EXCEPT:
Choices:
  A: first
  B: third
  C: fourth
  D: fifth
  E: sixth

S must be earlier than Y, so S cannot be in the last position.
J must be earlier than G, and G must be earlier than R, so G cannot be in the first position.
If S is in the first position, then Q must be in the third position, which means R must be in the fourth position. This leaves G and H to be in the fifth and sixth positions, but G must be earlier than R, so this is not possible.
If S is in the third position, then Q must be in the first position, which means R must be in the second position. This leaves G and H to be in the fourth and fifth positions, and J and Y to be in the sixth and seventh positions. This is a valid order.
If S is in the fourth position, then Q must be in the second position, which means R must be in the third position. This leaves G and H to be in the fifth and sixth positions, and J and Y to be in the first and seventh positions. This is not a valid order because J and Y are consecutive.
If S is in the fifth position, then Q must be in the third position, which means R must be in the fourth position. This leaves G and H to be in the first and second positions, and J and Y to be in the sixth and seventh positions. This is a valid order.
If S is in the sixth position, then Q must be in the fourth position, which means R must be in the fifth position. This leaves G and H to be in the first and second positions, and J and Y to be in the third and seventh positions. This is not a valid order because J and Y are consecutive.
